description: A condition in which a person loses the ability to think, remember, learn, make decisions, and solve problems. Symptoms may also include personality changes and emotional problems. There are many causes of dementia, including Alzheimer disease, brain cancer, and brain injury. Dementia usually gets worse over time.

name: Pneumonia due to Klebsiella pneumoniae
description: unknown disease

name: Urethral atrophy
description: unknown disease

name: Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder
description: A more severe and disabling form of premenstrual syndrome in which mood symptoms are the primary characteristic.

name: Sleep Apnea, Obstructive
description: A disorder characterized by recurrent apneas during sleep despite persistent respiratory efforts. It is due to upper airway obstruction. The respiratory pauses may induce HYPERCAPNIA or HYPOXIA. Cardiac arrhythmias and elevation of systemic and pulmonary arterial pressures may occur. Frequent partial arousals occur throughout sleep, resulting in relative SLEEP DEPRIVATION and daytime tiredness. Associated conditions include OBESITY; ACROMEGALY; MYXEDEMA; micrognathia; MYOTONIC DYSTROPHY; adenotonsilar dystrophy; and NEUROMUSCULAR DISEASES. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, p395)

name: Staphylococcal endocarditis
description: unknown disease

name: Klebsiella cystitis
description: unknown disease

name: Chlamydial pelvic inflammatory disease
description: unknown disease

name: Postoperative Nausea and Vomiting
description: Emesis and queasiness occurring after anesthesia.

name: Primary fibromyalgia syndrome
description: Emesis and queasiness occurring after anesthesia.

name: Pervasive Development Disorder
description: group of disorders characterized by delays in the development of socialization and communication skills; typical age of onset is before 3 years of age; symptoms may include problems with using and understanding language; difficulty relating to people, objects, and events; unusual play with toys and other objects; difficulty with changes in routine or familiar surroundings, and repetitive body movements or behavior patterns; AUTISM is the most characteristic and best studied PDD; other types of PDD include ASPERGER SYNDROME, Childhood Disintegrative Disorder, and RETT SYNDROME; prefer NTs where possible.

name: Metabolic Syndrome X
description: a multifaceted syndrome characterized by clustering of insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia, associated with dyslipidemia, essential hypertension, abdominal obesity, glucose intolerance or noninsulin dependent diabetes mellitus, and an increased risk of cardiovascular events.

name: Opiate Addiction
description: unknown disease

name: Pneumonic Plague
description: unknown disease

name: Pulmonary Thromboembolisms
description: unknown disease

name: Hepatitis B, Chronic
description: INFLAMMATION of the LIVER in humans caused by HEPATITIS B VIRUS lasting six months or more. It is primarily transmitted by parenteral exposure, such as transfusion of contaminated blood or blood products, but can also be transmitted via sexual or intimate personal contact.

name: Hepatitis C, Chronic
description: INFLAMMATION of the LIVER in humans that is caused by HEPATITIS C VIRUS lasting six months or more. Chronic hepatitis C can lead to LIVER CIRRHOSIS.

name: Non-Q wave myocardial infarction
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant neoplasm of esophagus
description: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the esophagus.

name: Larva Migrans, Cutaneous
description: unknown disease

name: Hydatidiform mole, benign
description: unknown disease

name: Alcohol problem
description: unknown disease

name: Meibomianitis
description: unknown disease

name: Low density lipoprotein increased
description: An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood. [HPO:probinson]

name: Ewings sarcoma
description: malignant tumor of bones which always arises in medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones, with pain, fever, and leukocytosis.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin
description: A carcinoma arising from the squamous cells of the epidermis. Skin squamous cell carcinoma is most commonly found on sun-exposed areas. The majority of the tumors are well-differentiated.

name: Streptococcus pyogenes infection
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant Glioma
description: A malignant neuroglial neoplasm. The term can apply to several primary neoplasm of the brain and spinal cord, including astrocytoma and oligodendroglioma in addition to others.

name: Craving for alcohol
description: unknown disease

name: Uric acid renal calculus
description: unknown disease

name: Peripheral arterial embolism
description: unknown disease

name: Vaginal ulcer
description: unknown disease

name: Methotrexate poisoning
description: unknown disease

name: Acetaminophen overdose
description: unknown disease

name: Antimetabolite overdose
description: unknown disease

name: Heparin overdose
description: unknown disease

name: Proteus septicemia
description: unknown disease

name: Escherichia coli urinary tract infection
description: unknown disease

name: Proteus urinary tract infection
description: unknown disease

name: Chronic idiopathic urticaria
description: Urticaria characterized by spontaneously recurring hives for 6 weeks or longer. [PMID:25807072]

name: Gastric spasm (disorder)
description: unknown disease

name: Decompensated cardiac failure
description: unknown disease

name: Exacerbation of multiple sclerosis
description: unknown disease

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of mouth
description: A squamous cell carcinoma arising from the oral cavity. It affects predominantly adults in their fifth and sixth decades of life and is associated with alcohol and tobacco use. Human papillomavirus is present in approximately half of the cases. It is characterized by a tendency to metastasize early to the lymph nodes. When the tumor is small, patients are often asymptomatic. Physical examination may reveal erythematous or white lesions or plaques. The majority of patients present with signs and symptoms of locally advanced disease including mucosal ulceration, pain, difficulty with speaking, chewing, and swallowing, bleeding, weight loss, and neck swelling. Patients may also present with swollen neck lymph nodes without any symptoms from the oropharyngeal tumor. The most significant prognostic factors are the size of the tumor and the lymph nodes status.

name: Osteosarcoma of bone
description: A usually aggressive malignant bone-forming mesenchymal neoplasm arising from the bone. It may arise de novo or from a pre-existing lesion of the bone. Pain and a palpable mass are the most frequent clinical sign and symptom. It may spread to other anatomic sites, particularly the lungs.

name: Septicemia due to enterococcus
description: unknown disease

name: Binge eating disorder
description: Eating excessive quantities of food, often after stressful events. Compare BULIMIA.

name: Cerebrovascular Occlusion
description: obstruction or closure which causes impairment of blood flow in the arteries and veins which supply the brain.

name: hormone deficiency
description: unknown disease

name: Infective cystitis
description: A disorder characterized by an infectious process involving the bladder.

name: Prostate carcinoma
description: Cancer that forms in tissues of the prostate (a gland in the male reproductive system found below the bladder and in front of the rectum). Prostate cancer usually occurs in older men.

name: Hot flushes
description: sudden, temporary sensation of heat predominantly experienced by women during menopause, and as a side effect of some hormone therapies.

name: Low Cardiac Output Syndrome
description: unknown disease

name: Cocaine Dependence
description: A psychologically and socially impaired state, with or without physiological changes, that develops as a result of using cocaine and which leads to compulsive behaviors to acquire the substance.

name: Choroidal Neovascularization
description: A pathological process consisting of the formation of new blood vessels in the CHOROID.

name: Hashimoto Disease
description: progressive enlargement of the thyroid gland, often associated with hypothyroidism.

name: contiguous stage II adult diffuse large cell lymphoma
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage II: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (II); or localized involvement of a single extralymphatic organ or site in association with regional lymph node involvement with or without involvement of other lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (IIE).

name: contiguous stage II adult Burkitt's lymphoma
description: Stage II: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (II) or localized involvement of a single associated extralymphatic organ or site and its regional lymph nodes with or without other lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (IIE). Note: The number of lymph node regions involved may be indicated by a subscript (e.g., II3). (from PDQ)

name: noncontiguous stage II adult diffuse large cell lymphoma
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage II: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (II); or localized involvement of a single extralymphatic organ or site in association with regional lymph node involvement with or without involvement of other lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (IIE).

name: noncontiguous stage II adult Burkitt's lymphoma
description: Stage II: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (II) or localized involvement of a single associated extralymphatic organ or site and its regional lymph nodes with or without other lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (IIE). Note: The number of lymph node regions involved may be indicated by a subscript (e.g., II3). (from PDQ)

name: Mantle cell lymphoma stage III
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage III: Involvement of lymph node regions on both sides of the diaphragm (III), which also may be accompanied by extralymphatic extension in association with adjacent lymph node involvement (IIIE) or by involvement of the spleen (IIIS) or both (IIIE,S).

name: Mantle cell lymphoma stage IV
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage IV: Diffuse or disseminated involvement of one or more extralymphatic organs, with or without associated lymph node involvement; or isolated extralymphatic organ involvement in the absence of adjacent regional lymph node involvement, but in conjunction with disease in distant site(s); or any involvement of the liver or bone marrow, lungs (other than by direct extension from another site), or cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Mantle cell lymphoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of a mantle cell lymphoma after a period of remission.

name: Brain Stem Neoplasms
description: Benign and malignant intra-axial tumors of the MESENCEPHALON; PONS; or MEDULLA OBLONGATA of the BRAIN STEM. Primary and metastatic neoplasms may occur in this location. Clinical features include ATAXIA, cranial neuropathies (see CRANIAL NERVE DISEASES), NAUSEA, hemiparesis (see HEMIPLEGIA), and quadriparesis. Primary brain stem neoplasms are more frequent in children. Histologic subtypes include GLIOMA; HEMANGIOBLASTOMA; GANGLIOGLIOMA; and EPENDYMOMA.

name: Epithelial ovarian cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Breast Carcinoma
description: A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

name: AOD misuse
description: unknown disease

name: alcohol sensitivity
description: unknown disease

name: advanced disease
description: unknown disease

name: Bacterial sepsis
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant neoplasm of gastrointestinal tract
description: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving any part of the digestive system.

name: Secondary malignant neoplasm of stomach
description: A malignant neoplasm that has spread to the stomach from another organ or system, or from another primary gastric tumor. The primary gastric tumor is not in continuity with the metastatic lesion. Representative examples of metastatic malignant neoplasms to the stomach include breast, lung, and esophageal metastatic carcinomas and melanomas.

name: Carcinoma in situ of adrenal cortex
description: unknown disease

name: Acute leukemia in remission
description: Acute leukemia not growing; responding to treatment.

name: heavy drinking
description: unknown disease

name: Mineral deficiency
description: unknown disease

name: male reproductive cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Idiopathic hypertrophic subaortic stenosis
description: unknown disease

name: Urethral Carcinoma
description: A carcinoma that arises from the urethra. Morphologically, the tumors are similar to those described in the bladder.

name: Hypoxemia
description: A finding indicating decreased oxygen levels in the blood.

name: Candidiasis, Vulvovaginal
description: Candidiasis of the vulva and/or vagina.

name: Organophosphate poisoning
description: Poisoning due to exposure to ORGANOPHOSPHORUS COMPOUNDS, such as ORGANOPHOSPHATES; ORGANOTHIOPHOSPHATES; and ORGANOTHIOPHOSPHONATES.

name: Adrenogenital disorder
description: unknown disease

name: Acute fungal otitis externa
description: unknown disease

name: Preterm premature rupture of membranes (disorder)
description: Spontaneous rupture of fetal membranes that occurs before the onset of labor and before 37 weeks.

name: Bacterial urinary infection
description: unknown disease

name: Infective otitis media
description: unknown disease

name: Infective blepharitis
description: unknown disease

name: Vitreomacular traction syndrome
description: The following must be present on at least one OCT (Optical coherence tomography) scan image: (i) Partial vitreous detachment as indicated by elevation of cortical vitreous above the retinal surface in the perifoveal area (ii) Persistent vitreous attachment.

name: Diabetic macular edema
description: unknown disease

name: Microalbuminuria
description: The presence of mildly increased concentrations of albumin in the urine (in adults, 30-150 mg per day). [Eurenomics:fschaefer]

name: Severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
description: unknown disease

name: Hyperuricemia
description: excessive uric acid or urate in blood as defined by its solubility in plasma at 37 degrees Celsius; greater than 0.42mmol per liter (7.0mg/dl) in men or 0.36mmol per liter (6.0mg/dl) in women; this condition is caused by overproduction of uric acid or impaired renal clearance; hyperuricemia can be acquired, drug-induced or genetically determined; it is associated with hypertension and gout.

name: Diabetic peripheral neuropathy
description: unknown disease

name: Paroxysmal atrial flutter
description: unknown disease

name: colon cancer liver metastasis
description: unknown disease

name: CRYPTOCOCCAL INFECTION DISSEMINATED
description: unknown disease

name: Diabetic foot infection

name: Head and neck cancer metastatic
description: A carcinoma that arises from the head and neck and has spread from the original site of growth to another anatomic site.

name: Intractable hiccups
description: unknown disease

name: hypertension chronic
description: unknown disease

name: Isolated systolic hypertension
description: Elevated systolic blood pressure without an elevated blood pressure. [PMID:21947466]

name: Hypertensive emergency
description: unknown disease

name: Hypertensive urgency
description: unknown disease

name: Inhalation injury
description: unknown disease

name: INTUBATION ENDOTRACHEAL PROLONGED

name: Infantile Severe Myoclonic Epilepsy
description: A genetic epilepsy of childhood with characteristics of drug-resistant seizures often induced by fever, presenting in previously healthy children, and which frequently leads to cognitive and motor impairment. Seizures can regress in adulthood but most patients have ongoing seizures that are refractory to medication. Around 85% of cases are due to a mutation or deletion in the SCN1A gene (2q24.3), encoding a voltage-gated sodium channel essential for the excitability of neurons. In families with a known SCN1A mutation, inheritance is autosomal dominant.

description: unknown disease

name: Narcolepsy-Cataplexy Syndrome

name: Classical phenylketonuria
description: A genetic disorder caused by a mutation in the gene that encodes the enzyme phenylalanine hydroxylase, resulting in a severe form of phenylketonuria.

name: Subarachnoid Hemorrhage, Aneurysmal
description: unknown disease

name: Cancer of Urinary Tract
description: A primary or metastatic malignant tumor involving the urinary system. Common tumor types include carcinomas, lymphomas, and sarcomas.

name: Malignant Peripheral Nerve Sheath Tumor
description: A malignant neurilemmoma with nerve sheath differentiation. It is often associated with NEUROFIBROMATOSIS 1 and RHABDOMYOSARCOMA.

name: Anterior Ischemic Optic Neuropathy
description: unknown disease

name: Carbamoyl-Phosphate Synthase I Deficiency Disease
description: genetic aminoacidopathy due to a deficiency of carbamoyl phosphate synthase (ammonia); characteristic symptoms include pronounced hyperammonemia without orotic aciduria, protein intolerance, and neurologic disorders.

name: Gait Disorders, Neurologic
description: Gait abnormalities that are a manifestation of nervous system dysfunction. These conditions may be caused by a wide variety of disorders which affect motor control, sensory feedback, and muscle strength including: CENTRAL NERVOUS SYSTEM DISEASES; PERIPHERAL NERVOUS SYSTEM DISEASES; NEUROMUSCULAR DISEASES; or MUSCULAR DISEASES.

name: Acute Cerebrovascular Accidents
description: unknown disease

name: Multiple Sclerosis, Secondary Progressive
description: unknown disease

name: Multiple Sclerosis, Relapsing-Remitting
description: A type of multiple sclerosis characterized by intermittent flare-ups with a return to few or no symptoms.

name: Neuroaspergillosis
description: Infections of the nervous system caused by fungi of the genus ASPERGILLUS, most commonly ASPERGILLUS FUMIGATUS. Aspergillus infections may occur in immunocompetent hosts, but are more prevalent in individuals with IMMUNOLOGIC DEFICIENCY SYNDROMES. The organism may spread to the nervous system from focal infections in the lung, mastoid region, sinuses, inner ear, bones, eyes, gastrointestinal tract, and heart. Sinus infections may be locally invasive and enter the intracranial compartment, producing MENINGITIS, FUNGAL; cranial neuropathies; and abscesses in the frontal lobes of the brain. (From Joynt, Clinical Neurology, 1998, Ch 27, pp62-3)

name: soft tissue sarcoma, adult, stage IIB
description: Infections of the nervous system caused by fungi of the genus ASPERGILLUS, most commonly ASPERGILLUS FUMIGATUS. Aspergillus infections may occur in immunocompetent hosts, but are more prevalent in individuals with IMMUNOLOGIC DEFICIENCY SYNDROMES. The organism may spread to the nervous system from focal infections in the lung, mastoid region, sinuses, inner ear, bones, eyes, gastrointestinal tract, and heart. Sinus infections may be locally invasive and enter the intracranial compartment, producing MENINGITIS, FUNGAL; cranial neuropathies; and abscesses in the frontal lobes of the brain. (From Joynt, Clinical Neurology, 1998, Ch 27, pp62-3)

name: soft tissue sarcoma, adult, stage IIC
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant Pleural Mesothelioma
description: A malignant neoplasm that arises from mesothelial cells in the pleura and shows a diffuse growth pattern. It arises on the parietal and sometimes visceral pleura as multiple small nodules that later become confluent and invade the chest wall adipose tissue and muscle. Asbestos exposure is the main cause for the development of pleural malignant mesothelioma. It usually affects patients over sixty years of age. The latency period is long. Patients usually present with pleural effusion, dyspnea and chest wall pain. Additional signs and symptoms include chills, sweating, weight loss, and weakness. Morphologic variants include epithelioid, desmoplastic, sarcomatoid, and biphasic mesothelioma. The clinical course is usually aggressive.

name: Type 2 diabetes mellitus with established diabetic nephropathy
description: unknown disease

name: Itching of ear
description: unknown disease

name: Adenomatous polyp of colon
description: A polypoid adenoma that arises from and protrudes into the lumen of the colon. Epithelial dysplasia is always present. According to the architectural pattern it is classified as tubular, tubulovillous, or villous.

name: Infection caused by Helicobacter pylori
description: A bacterial infection of the stomach, caused by Helicobacter pylori. It is associated with the development of peptic ulcer and mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue lymphoma.

name: Pregnancy associated hypertension
description: A blood pressure elevation after 20 weeks of gestation in the absence of either proteinuria or systemic findings like thrombocytopenia, impaired liver function, progressive renal insufficiency, pulmonary edema or the new-onset of cerebral or visual disturbances.

name: Bipolar I disorder
description: unknown disease

name: Cystitis escherichia
description: unknown disease

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa infection
description: unknown disease

name: Hepatobiliary neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the liver parenchyma, bile ducts, and gallbladder. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include hepatocellular adenoma, bile duct adenoma, and gallbladder lipoma. Representative examples of malignant neoplasms include hepatocellular carcinoma, intrahepatic and extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, and gallbladder carcinoma.

name: Bacterial keratitis
description: unknown disease

name: Bacterial meningitis due to Gram-negative bacteria
description: unknown disease

name: Pneumonia due to Gram negative bacteria

name: Colorectal cancer recurrent
description: The reemergence of colorectal carcinoma after a period of remission.

name: Oesophageal carcinoma recurrent
description: An esophageal carcinoma which has reappeared after a period of remission or after presumed treatment.

name: Pancreatic carcinoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of pancreatic carcinoma after a period of remission.

name: Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia stage 2
description: Risk: Intermediate; Findings: Lymphocytosis, adenopathy, and enlarged spleen and/or liver; Survival (months): 72. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

name: Chronic lymphocytic leukaemia stage 4
description: There are too many lymphocytes in the blood and too few platelets. The lymph nodes, liver, or spleen may be larger than normal and there may be too few red blood cells.

name: T-cell lymphoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma after a period of remission.

name: T-cell lymphoma refractory
description: T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma resistant to treatment.

name: Lung squamous cell carcinoma recurrent
description: The re-emergence of squamous cell lung carcinoma after a period of remission.

name: Lung squamous cell carcinoma stage IV
description: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the lung and has metastasized to another anatomic site.

name: Small Lymphocytic Lymphoma
description: A malignant neoplasm composed of small lymphocytes.

name: B-cell small lymphocytic lymphoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of small lymphocytic lymphoma after a period of remission.

name: B-cell small lymphocytic lymphoma stage I
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage I: Involvement of a single lymph node region (I); or localized involvement of a single extralymphatic organ or site in the absence of any lymph node involvement (IE).

name: B-cell small lymphocytic lymphoma stage II
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage II: Involvement of two or more lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (II); or localized involvement of a single extralymphatic organ or site in association with regional lymph node involvement with or without involvement of other lymph node regions on the same side of the diaphragm (IIE).

name: B-cell small lymphocytic lymphoma stage III
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage III: Involvement of lymph node regions on both sides of the diaphragm (III), which also may be accompanied by extralymphatic extension in association with adjacent lymph node involvement (IIIE) or by involvement of the spleen (IIIS) or both (IIIE,S).

name: B-cell small lymphocytic lymphoma stage IV
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage IV: Diffuse or disseminated involvement of one or more extralymphatic organs, with or without associated lymph node involvement; or isolated extralymphatic organ involvement in the absence of adjacent regional lymph node involvement, but in conjunction with disease in distant site(s); or any involvement of the liver or bone marrow, lungs (other than by direct extension from another site), or cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Monocytoid B-cell lymphoma
description: A rare, indolent B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma with characteristics of abnormal clonal proliferation of mature B-lymphocytes with involvement of the lymph nodes, sometimes the bone marrow, and rarely the blood. Clinically it presents with disseminated peripheral, abdominal and/or thoracic lymphadenopathy. Association with Hepatitis C virus and chronic inflammation has been reported.

name: Endothelial dysfunction
description: unknown disease

name: Acute exacerbation of chronic bronchitis
description: unknown disease

name: Acute GVH disease
description: A complication of allogeneic bone marrow or blood cell transplantation, occurring within the first three months of transplantation, in which donor lymphoid cells damage the host tissue.

name: Arthritic pains
description: unknown disease

name: Infection in solid organ transplant recipients
description: unknown disease

name: Moraxella catarrhalis pneumonia
description: unknown disease

name: Legionella pneumophila pneumonia
description: unknown disease

name: Plasmodium falciparum infection
description: unknown disease

name: Septic arthritis haemophilus
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant melanoma, metastatic
description: unknown disease

name: Hepatoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of hepatocellular carcinoma after a period of remission

name: Mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome recurrent
description: The reemergence of mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome after a period of remission.

name: Mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome stage I
description: Stage I includes: IA (T1, N0, M0, B0-1); IB (T2, N0, M0, B0-1). T1: Limited patches, papules, and/or plaques covering less than 10% of the skin surface. May further stratify into T1a (patch only) vs. T1b (plaque +/- patch). T2: Patches, papules, or plaques covering 10% or more of the skin surface. May further stratify into T2a (patch only) vs. T2b (plaque +/- patch). N0: No clinically abnormal peripheral lymph nodes; biopsy not required. M0: No visceral organ involvement. B0: Absence of significant blood involvement: 5% or less of peripheral blood lymphocytes are atypical (Sezary cells). B1: Low blood tumor burden: more than 5% of peripheral blood lymphocytes are atypical (Sezary cells) but does not meet the criteria of B2. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome stage II
description: Stage II is divided into stages IIA and IIB. In stage IIA, any amount of the skin surface is covered with patches and/or plaques (areas of abnormal tissue). Lymph nodes are enlarged but cancer has not spread to them. In stage IIB, one or more tumors (lumps of malignant cells) are found on the skin. Lymph nodes may be enlarged but cancer has not spread to them. Stage II may also be classified based on how many abnormal lymphocytes (white blood cells) are found in the blood.

name: Mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome stage III
description: In stage III, nearly all of the skin is reddened and there may be patches, plaques, or tumors. Lymph nodes may be enlarged but cancer has not spread to them. Stage III may also be classified based on how many abnormal lymphocytes (white blood cells) are found in the blood.

name: Mycosis fungoides/Sezary syndrome stage IV
description: Stage IV includes: IVA1 (T1-4, N0-2, M0, B2); IVA2 (T1-4, N3, M0, B0-2); IVB (T1-4, N0-3, M1, B0-2). T1: Limited patches, papules, and/or plaques covering less than 10% of the skin surface. May further stratify into T1a (patch only) vs. T1b (plaque +/- patch). T2: Patches, papules, or plaques covering 10% or more of the skin surface. May further stratify into T2a (patch only) vs. T2b (plaque +/- patch). T3: One or more tumors (equal or greater than 1 cm diameter). T4: Confluence of erythema covering 80% or more of body surface area. N0: No clinically abnormal peripheral lymph nodes; biopsy not required. N1: Clinically abnormal peripheral lymph nodes; histopathology Dutch grade 1 or NCI LN0-2. N2: Clinically abnormal peripheral lymph nodes; histopathology Dutch grade 2 or NCI LN3. N3: Clinically abnormal peripheral lymph nodes; histopathology Dutch grades 3-4 or NCI LN4; clone positive or negative. M0: No visceral organ involvement. M1: Visceral involvement (must have pathology confirmation and organ involved should be specified). B0: Absence of significant blood involvement: 5% or less of peripheral blood lymphocytes are atypical (Sezary cells). B1: Low blood tumor burden: more than 5% of peripheral blood lymphocytes are atypical (Sezary cells) but does not meet the criteria of B2. B2: High blood tumor burden: 1000/microL Sezary cells or more with positive clone. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Epithelioid mesothelioma, malignant
description: A malignant neoplasm arising from mesothelial cells. It is characterized by the presence of cells with epithelioid morphology. The epithelioid cells usually have eosinophilic cytoplasm, bland nuclei, and form tubulopapillary, microglandular, or sheet-like patterns.

name: Superficial basal cell carcinoma
description: A variant of basal cell carcinoma of the skin presenting as erythematous, often multiple patches. Morphologically, it is characterized by the presence of superficial lobules of basaloid cells projecting into the dermis. The basaloid cell lobules are surrounded by myxoid stroma and are usually confined to the papillary dermis.

name: Gastric carcinoma stage IV
description: Stage IV includes: (T4, N1-3, M0); (T1-3, N3, M0); (Any T, Any N, M1). M1:Distant metastasis. (AJCC 6th ed.)

name: Meningitis due to Bacteroides
description: unknown disease

name: Renal disease with edema NOS
description: unknown disease

name: Chronic graft-versus-host disease
description: A complication of allogeneic bone marrow or blood cell transplantation, usually occurring more than three months after transplantation, in which donor lymphoid cells damage the host tissue.

name: Hyperkeratosis
description: skin thickening caused by excessive production of a protein called keratins

name: Sarcopenia
description: loss of skeletal muscle mass, quality and strength; may be associated with aging.

name: Traumatic Brain Injury
description: Brain injury resulting from an accident, surgery, or other trauma.

name: Cardiotoxicity
description: Toxicity that impairs or damages the heart. This condition is often caused by the administration of a pharmaceutical agent that initiates a poisonous or toxic response in cardiac tissue.

name: Urinary tract infection fungal
description: unknown disease

name: Advanced cancer
description: A malignant neoplasm that has spread extensively to other anatomic sites or is no longer responding to treatment.

name: Non-ischemic cardiomyopathy
description: unknown disease

name: Candidemia
description: A form of invasive candidiasis where species of CANDIDA are present in the blood.

name: Treatment related secondary malignancy
description: A disorder characterized by development of a malignancy most probably as a result of treatment for a previously existing malignancy.

name: Haemophilus parainfluenzae pneumonia
description: unknown disease

name: Cardiomyopathies
description: condition in which there is a deviation from or interruption of the normal structure or function of the myocardium, the middle and thickest layer of the heart wall, composed of heart muscle.

name: Overactive Bladder
description: Symptom of overactive detrusor muscle of the URINARY BLADDER that contracts with abnormally high frequency and urgency. Overactive bladder is characterized by the frequent feeling of needing to urinate during the day, during the night, or both. URINARY INCONTINENCE may or may not be present.

name: Optic Atrophy, Hereditary, Leber
description: A maternally linked genetic disorder that presents in mid-life as acute or subacute central vision loss leading to central scotoma and blindness. The disease has been associated with missense mutations in the mtDNA, in genes for Complex I, III, and IV polypeptides, that can act autonomously or in association with each other to cause the disease. (from Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man, http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/Omim/, MIM#535000 (April 17, 2001))

name: Cerebral Ischemia
description: Diminished or absent blood supply to the brain caused by obstruction (thrombosis or embolism) of an artery resulting in neurologic damage.

name: Sleeplessness
description: A disruption in amount and quality of sleep that impairs functioning.

name: ovarian neoplasm
description: new abnormal ovary tissue that grows by excessive cellular division and proliferation more rapidly than normal and continues to grow after the stimuli that initiated the new growth cease.

name: Oropharyngeal candidiasis
description: Infection of the oropharynx with, or disease caused by, Candida, especially C. albicans. This disease usually results from debilitation (as in immunosuppression and especially AIDS), physiologic change, prolonged administration of antibiotics, and iatrogenic and barrier breakage. SYN candidosis, moniliasis.

name: Platelet aggregation inhibition
description: Any platelet aggregation process that decreases the rate, frequency or extent of platelet aggregation.

name: Renal cancer metastatic
description: unknown disease

name: cognitive/functional effects
description: unknown disease

name: Vitamin B 6 Deficiency
description: condition due to deficiency of vitamin B6.

name: Metastatic Prostate Carcinoma
description: A carcinoma that arises from the prostate gland and has spread to other anatomic sites.

name: Evidence of liver transplantation
description: unknown disease

name: Vascular inflammations
description: unknown disease

name: Ischemic stroke
description: Stroke due to BRAIN ISCHEMIA resulting in interruption or reduction of blood flow to a part of the brain. When obstruction is due to a BLOOD CLOT formed within in a cerebral blood vessel it is a thrombotic stroke. When obstruction is formed elsewhere and moved to block a cerebral blood vessel (see CEREBRAL EMBOLISM) it is referred to as embolic stroke. Wake-up stroke refers to ischemic stroke occurring during sleep while cryptogenic stroke refers to ischemic stroke of unknown origin.

name: Acute Coronary Syndrome
description: A disorder characterized by signs and symptoms related to acute ischemia of the myocardium secondary to coronary artery disease. The clinical presentation covers a spectrum of heart diseases from unstable angina to myocardial infarction.

name: Infection caused by Enterobacter
description: unknown disease

name: Colorectal cancer metastatic
description: unknown disease

name: Rhinosinusitis
description: Inflammation of the mucous membranes lining the nose and paranasal sinuses.

name: Meningeal Leukemia
description: Infiltration of the meninges by an acute or chronic leukemia.

name: Primary hypogonadism
description: Ovarian or testicular dysfunction that results in high concentrations of gonadotropins.

name: Nosocomial pneumonia
description: Pneumonia acquired during a hospital stay.

name: Citrobacter sepsis
description: unknown disease

name: Enterobacter pneumonia
description: unknown disease

name: Peptostreptococcus infection
description: unknown disease

name: Intraabdominal Infections
description: Infection within the PERITONEAL CAVITY. A frequent cause is an ANASTOMOTIC LEAK following surgery.

name: Liver cell carcinoma non-resectable
description: A hepatocellular carcinoma that is not amenable to surgical resection.

name: Allergic keratoconjunctivitis
description: unknown disease

name: non-gonococcal urethritis (NGU)
description: Inflammation of the urethra secondary to infection with any bacteria other than Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

name: insular thyroid cancer
description: Inflammation of the urethra secondary to infection with any bacteria other than Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

name: Invasive Ductal Breast Carcinoma
description: An invasive (infiltrating) CARCINOMA of the mammary ductal system (MAMMARY GLANDS) in the human BREAST.

name: Breakthrough Pain
description: Acute pain that comes on rapidly despite the use of pain medication.

name: Heart Failure, Systolic
description: Heart failure caused by abnormal myocardial contraction during SYSTOLE leading to defective cardiac emptying.

name: Persistent pulmonary hypertension
description: unknown disease

name: Gestational Trophoblastic Neoplasms
description: Disorder characterized by abnormal proliferation of trophoblasts during pregnancy, of a type which is invasive or metastatic.

name: HIV-Associated Lipodystrophy Syndrome
description: Defective metabolism leading to fat maldistribution in patients infected with HIV. The etiology appears to be multifactorial and probably involves some combination of infection-induced alterations in metabolism, direct effects of antiretroviral therapy, and patient-related factors.

name: Malignant neoplasm of ovary
description: A primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm involving the ovary. Most primary malignant ovarian neoplasms are either carcinomas (serous, mucinous, or endometrioid adenocarcinomas) or malignant germ cell tumors. Metastatic malignant neoplasms to the ovary include carcinomas, lymphomas, and melanomas.

name: Carnitine deficiency
description: A decreased concentration of carnitine in the blood. [HPO:gcarletti]

name: Critical limb ischemia
description: unknown disease

name: Respiratory Failure
description: respiratory function fails to maintain adequate oxygen supply and carbon dioxide removal.

name: Endometrial adenocarcinoma
description: A malignant glandular neoplasm of the uterine lining.

name: Pancreatic carcinoma stage I
description: unknown disease

name: Pancreatic carcinoma stage II
description: unknown disease

name: Pancreatic carcinoma stage III
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IV Pancreatic Cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Recurrent respiratory papillomatosis
description: A rare disease caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV), most commonly types 6 and 11, that affects tissue along the respiratory tract with the majority of cases affecting the larynx. The disease has a bimodal distribution and manifests in those younger than age 5, juvenile-onset recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (JORRP), and those older than age 40, adult-onset recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (AORRP). JORRP is more common and more severe in presentation than AORRP. In a small percentage of patients, respiratory papillomas may undergo malignant transformation to squamous cell carcinomas that have a poor prognosis.

name: Mammary Carcinoma, Human
description: A rare disease caused by the human papillomavirus (HPV), most commonly types 6 and 11, that affects tissue along the respiratory tract with the majority of cases affecting the larynx. The disease has a bimodal distribution and manifests in those younger than age 5, juvenile-onset recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (JORRP), and those older than age 40, adult-onset recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (AORRP). JORRP is more common and more severe in presentation than AORRP. In a small percentage of patients, respiratory papillomas may undergo malignant transformation to squamous cell carcinomas that have a poor prognosis.

name: Other sickle-cell disease with vaso-occlusive pain
description: unknown disease

name: Rhinorrhea
description: Excess nasal drainage.

name: Anemia, Diamond-Blackfan
description: An inherited condition characterized by aplasia of the erythroid series only. The white cells and platelets are not affected. Patients develop anemia usually in infancy.

name: Infection by Pasteurella multocida
description: unknown disease

name: Late latent syphilis
description: Latent syphilis when infection was acquired more than twelve months previously.

name: Proteus pneumonia
description: unknown disease

name: Pelvic inflammatory disease due to Mycoplasma hominis
description: unknown disease

name: Disorder of transplanted kidney
description: A disease or disorder that is associated with a transplanted kidney.

name: Sarcoma
description: any of a group of tumors usually arising from connective tissue, although the term now includes some of epithelial origin; most are malignant.

name: Graft failure
description: unknown disease

name: Fungal keratitis
description: Keratitis caused by fungi.

name: Diarrhoea predominant irritable bowel syndrome
description: unknown disease

name: Invasive Fungal Infections
