name: Eosinophilic gastroenteritis
description: Gastroenteritis that is characterized by eosinophilic infiltration.

name: Female genital tract infection
description: unknown disease

name: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
description: A behavior disorder in which the essential features are signs of developmentally inappropriate inattention, impulsivity, and hyperactivity.

name: Poorly Differentiated Thyroid Carcinoma
description: An adenocarcinoma arising from the thyroid gland showing only limited evidence of follicular cell differentiation. Microscopically, the adenocarcinoma cells are arranged in insular, solid, and trabecular patterns. There is associated necrosis, and vascular invasion. The prognosis depends on the tumor stage, complete or partial surgical removal of the tumor, and the degree of response to radioactive iodine therapy. (adapted from WHO Tumors of Endocrine Organs, IARC Press, Lyon 2004)

name: Major Depressive Disorder
description: Affective disorder marked by dysphoric mood, inactivity, lack of interest, insomnia, feelings of worthlessness, diminished ability to think, and thoughts of suicide. Use DEPRESSION (EMOTION) for nonclinical depression.

name: Disorder of vitamin C
description: unknown disease

name: FIGO stage finding for vulvar carcinoma
description: unknown disease

name: Asthma night-time symptoms
description: unknown disease

name: Recurrent herpes simplex labialis
description: Recurrent episodes of oral herpes, typically characterized by blisters or ulcers on the gums, lips and/or tongue caused by herpes virus. []

name: Recurrent genital herpes simplex
description: Recurrent episodes of genital herpes, typically characterized by stages of erythema, papules, short-lived vesicles, painful ulcers, and crusts on the skin of the genitals and surrounding area, and that typically resolve over a period of 2 to 3 weeks. [PMID:27532832]

name: Streptococcal infection of skin
description: unknown disease

name: Onychomycosis of fingernails
description: unknown disease

name: Onychomycosis of toenails
description: unknown disease

name: Drug-induced mucositis
description: unknown disease

name: TNF receptor-associated periodic fever syndrome (TRAPS)
description: unknown disease

name: Anaplastic large T-cell systemic malignant lymphoma
description: unknown disease

name: Meibomian gland dysfunction
description: A chronic dysfunction of MEIBOMIAN GLANDS characterized by altered tear film stability and function due to a decrease or alteration in lipid quality/content in meibum. It is often associated with evaporative-type DRY EYE SYNDROME.

name: Herpes zoster keratitis
description: unknown disease

name: Infection due to Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae (disorder)
description: An infection caused by Erysipelothrix rhusiopathiae that is almost wholly restricted to persons who in their occupation handle infected fish, shellfish, poultry, or meat. Three forms of this condition exist: a mild localized form manifested by local swelling and redness of the skin; a diffuse form that might present with fever; and a rare systemic form associated with endocarditis.

name: Postnatal infection
description: Culture-positive postnatal infections associated with sensorineural hearing loss, including confirmed bacterial and viral (especially herpes viruses and varicella) meningitis.

name: Chlamydial urethritis
description: unknown disease

name: Genitourinary tract infection
description: unknown disease

name: Metastasis from malignant tumor of colon
description: unknown disease

name: Sucrase-isomaltase deficiency, congenital
description: characterized by the deficiency or absence of the enzymes sucrase and isomaltase existing at, and usually before birth; this enzyme complex (sucrase-isomaltase) assists in the breakdown of a certain sugar (ie, sucrose) and certain products of starch digestion (dextrins); only evident soon after birth when sucrose or starches, such as found in modified milk formulas with sucrose or polycose, are ingested by an affected infant, breast-fed infants or those on lactose-only formula manifest no symptoms until such time as sucrose (found in fruit juices, solid foods, and/or some medications) is introduced into the diet.

name: Subacute bursitis
description: unknown disease

name: Disorder of shoulder
description: unknown disease

name: Inflammatory disorder
description: An infectious or non infectious disorder characterized by signs and symptoms derived from focal or extensive tissue infiltration by acute (e.g., polymorphonuclear) or chronic (e.g., lymphocytic-plasmacytic) inflammatory cells. Representative examples of infectious disorders include viral infections, bacterial infections, and parasitic infections. Representative examples of non-infectious inflammatory disorders include inflammatory bowel disease and inflammatory polyps.

name: Primary Effusion Lymphoma
description: A large B-cell lymphoma usually presenting as a serous effusion without detectable tumor masses. It is universally associated with human herpes virus 8 (HHV8), also called Kaposi sarcoma-associated herpesvirus. It mostly occurs in the setting of immunodeficiency. The most common sites of involvement are the pleural, pericardial, and peritoneal cavities. Rare HHV8-positive lymphomas indistinguishable from primary effusion lymphomas (PEL) present as solid tumor masses, and have been termed extracavitary PEL. The prognosis is extremely unfavorable. (WHO 2017)

name: Precursor T-cell lymphoblastic lymphoma
description: A type of non-Hodgkin lymphoma in which too many T-cell lymphoblasts (immature white blood cells) are found in the lymph nodes and spleen. It is most common in young men.

name: Leukemia, Myeloid, Chronic, Atypical, BCR-ABL Negative
description: A myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm characterized by the principal involvement of the neutrophil series with leukocytosis and multilineage dysplasia. The neoplastic cells do not have a Philadelphia chromosome or the BCR/ABL fusion gene. (WHO, 2001)

name: Chronic myeloproliferative disorder
description: A clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorder, characterized by proliferation in the bone marrow of one or more of the myeloid (i.e., granulocytic, erythroid, megakaryocytic, and mast cell) lineages. It is primarily a neoplasm of adults. (WHO 2008)

name: Acute ST segment elevation myocardial infarction (disorder)
description: unknown disease

name: Primary malignant neoplasm of gastrointestinal tract
description: unknown disease

name: Fusospirochetal pharyngitis
description: unknown disease

name: Staphylococcus aureus infection
description: An infectious process in which the bacteria Staphylococcus aureus is present.

name: Adenocarcinoma of large intestine
description: The most common type of colorectal carcinoma. It is characterized by the presence of malignant glandular epithelial cells invading through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa. Histologic variants include mucinous adenocarcinoma, signet ring cell carcinoma, medullary carcinoma, serrated adenocarcinoma, cribriform comedo-type adenocarcinoma, and micropapillary adenocarcinoma.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of pharynx
description: A squamous cell carcinoma that arises from the pharynx.

name: Allergic otitis externa
description: unknown disease

name: Cardiovascular event
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IV Skin Melanoma
description: A melanoma that arises from the skin and has metastasized to another anatomic site.

name: childhood chronic myelogenous leukemia
description: A chronic myelogenous leukemia occurring during childhood.

name: Myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm, unclassifiable
description: This entity includes cases that have clinical, laboratory, and morphologic features that support the diagnosis of both a myelodysplastic syndrome and a myeloproliferative neoplasm, but do not meet the criteria for any of the other entities included in the myelodysplastic/myeloproliferative neoplasm category. (WHO, 2001)

name: Mucocutaneous leishmaniasis
description: A disease characterized by the chronic, progressive spread of lesions from New World cutaneous leishmaniasis caused by species of the L. braziliensis complex to the nasal, pharyngeal, and buccal mucosa some time after the appearance of the initial cutaneous lesion. Nasal obstruction and epistaxis are frequent presenting symptoms.

name: Chronic left ventricular failure
description: unknown disease

name: Pancreatic Endocrine Carcinoma
description: A primary malignant neoplasm of the pancreatic ISLET CELLS. Usually it involves the non-INSULIN-producing cell types, the PANCREATIC ALPHA CELLS and the pancreatic delta cells (SOMATOSTATIN-SECRETING CELLS) in GLUCAGONOMA and SOMATOSTATINOMA, respectively.

name: Hormone refractory prostate cancer
description: Prostate carcinoma that grows and continues to spread despite the surgical removal of the testes or medical intervention to block androgen production.

name: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Arising from Previous Myelodysplastic Syndrome
description: An acute myeloid leukemia developing in patients with a prior history of myelodysplastic syndrome.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the gastroesophageal junction
description: An adenocarcinoma that arises from and straddles the junction of the stomach and esophagus. The category of adenocarcinomas of the gastroesophageal junction also includes the majority of adenocarcinomas previously called gastric cardia adenocarcinomas. Squamous cell carcinomas that affect or cross the junction of the stomach and esophagus are classified as carcinomas of the distal esophagus. Adenocarcinoma of the gastroesophageal junction occurs more often in Caucasian middle aged and elderly males. Clinical signs and symptoms include dysphagia, abdominal pain, and weight loss. The prognosis depends on the completeness of the surgical resection, the number of lymph nodes involved by cancer, and the presence or absence of postoperative complications. The presence of TP53 mutations indicates worse prognosis.

name: Adult Kidney Wilms Tumor
description: Wilms tumor of the kidney which occurs in adults.

name: Alkylating Agent-Related Acute Myeloid Leukemia
description: Wilms tumor of the kidney which occurs in adults.

name: Childhood Kidney Wilms Tumor
description: A Wilms tumor that occurs in children.

name: Extragonadal Seminoma
description: unknown disease

name: Hepatosplenic T-cell lymphoma
description: An extranodal, mature T-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma that originates from cytotoxic T-cells, usually of gamma/delta T-cell type. It is characterized by the presence of medium-size neoplastic lymphocytes infiltrating the hepatic sinusoids. A similar infiltrating pattern is also present in the spleen and bone marrow that are usually involved at the time of the diagnosis.

name: Hereditary Nonpolyposis Colorectal Cancer
description: An inherited syndrome characterized by the development of several cancers, particularly colon and rectal cancers. It includes Lynch syndrome which is associated with germline mutations in DNA mismatch-repair genes and familial colorectal cancer type X which is characterized by the absence of germline mutations in DNA mismatch-repair genes.

name: High Grade Sarcoma
description: A sarcoma with the morphologic features of a high grade tumor and lack of differentiation.

name: Malignant Extragonadal Germ Cell Tumor
description: A malignant germ cell tumor that develops as a primary tumor in an anatomic site other than the testis or ovary.

name: Malignant Extragonadal Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
description: A malignant non-seminomatous germ cell tumor that develops as a primary tumor in an anatomic site other than the testis or ovary.

name: Ovarian Serous Adenocarcinoma
description: An adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary and is characterized by the presence of malignant epithelial cells that, in well differentiated tumors, resemble the epithelium of the fallopian tube or, in poorly differentiated tumors, show anaplastic features and marked nuclear atypia.

name: Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma
description: An infiltrating adenocarcinoma that arises from the epithelial cells of the pancreas. It affects males more often than females and the patients are usually over 50 years of age. Microscopically it is characterized by the presence of glandular (ductal) differentiation and desmoplastic stroma formation. Signs and symptoms include pain, loss of weight, and jaundice. It grows rapidly and is usually detected after it has metastasized to other anatomic sites. The prognosis is usually poor.

name: Recurrent Head and Neck Carcinoma
description: The reemergence of carcinoma in the head and neck region after a period of remission.

name: Stage IA Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
description: Stage IA includes: (T1a, N0, M0); (T1b, N0, M0). T1a: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. T1b: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). N0: No regional lymph metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IB Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
description: Stage I non-small cell lung cancer is divided into stages IA and IB. In stage IB, cancer has not spread to the lymph nodes and one or more of the following is true: (1) the tumor is larger than 3 centimeters but not larger than 5 centimeters; (2) cancer has spread to the main bronchus and is at least 2 centimeters below where the trachea joins the bronchus; (3) cancer has spread to the innermost layer of the membrane that covers the lung; and/or (4) part of the lung has collapsed or become inflamed.

name: Stage IIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IIA includes: T2, N0, M0, G3. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G3: Poorly differentiated. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIA Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
description: Stage IIA includes: (T2b, N0, M0); (T1a, N1, M0); (T1b, N1, M0); (T2a, N1, M0). T2b: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension. T1a: Lung cancer with a tumor size of 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). The uncommon superficial tumor of any size with its invasive component limited to the bronchial wall, which may extend proximal to the main bronchus, is also classified as T1a. T1b: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 2 cm but 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura and without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus). T2a: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 3 cm but 5 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes and intrapulmonary lymph nodes, including involvement by direct extension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IIB includes: (T3, N0, M0, Any G); (T1-2, N1, M0, Any G). T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T1: Tumor invades lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in 1-2 regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIB Non-Small Cell Lung Carcinoma
description: Stage IIB includes: (T2b, N1, M0); (T3, N0, M0). T2b: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 5 cm but 7 cm or less in greatest dimension. T3: Lung cancer with a tumor size more than 7 cm or one that directly invades any of the following: parietal pleural (PL3) chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors), diaphragm, phrenic nerve, mediastinal pleura, parietal pericardium; or tumor in the main bronchus (less than 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina); or associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Lung cancer with metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes and intrapulmonary lymph nodes, including involvement by direct extension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N2, M0); (T4a, N2, M0); T4a: Supraglottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscle of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). Glottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the outer cortex of the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscles of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). Subglottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades cricoid or thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscles of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. N2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Laryngeal Verrucous Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N2, M0); (T4a, N2, M0); T4a: Supraglottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscle of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). Glottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades through the outer cortex of the thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscles of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). Subglottis: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades cricoid or thyroid cartilage and/or invades tissues beyond the larynx (e.g., trachea, soft tissues of neck including deep extrinsic muscles of the tongue, strap muscles, thyroid, or esophagus). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. N2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Oral Cavity Verrucous Carcinoma
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IVA Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N2, M0); (T4a, N2, M0). T4a: Tumor with moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades the larynx, extrinsic muscle of tongue, medial pterygoid, hard palate, or mandible. Mucosal extension to lingual surface of epiglottis from primary tumors of the base of the tongue and vallecula does not constitute invasion of larynx. T1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension. T3: Tumor measuring more than 4 centimeters in greatest dimension or extension to lingual surface of epiglottis. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. N2: Tumor with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: (T4b, Any N, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T4b: Supraglottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. Glottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. Subglottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. N3: Metastasis in a lymph node, more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Laryngeal Verrucous Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: (T4b, Any N, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T4b: Supraglottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. Glottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. Subglottis: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades prevertebral space, encases carotid artery, or invades mediastinal structures. N3: Metastasis in a lymph node, more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Oral Cavity Verrucous Carcinoma
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IVB Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: (T4b, Any N, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T4b: Tumor with very advanced local disease. Tumor invades lateral pterygoid muscle, pterygoid plates, lateral nasopharynx, or skull base or encases carotid artery. N3: Tumor with metastasis in a lymph node more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Laryngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Laryngeal Verrucous Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Oral Cavity Verrucous Carcinoma
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IVC Oropharyngeal Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IV Extragonadal Non-Seminomatous Germ Cell Tumor
description: unknown disease

name: Stage IV Extragonadal Seminoma
description: unknown disease

name: Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
description: A germ cell tumor arising from the testis. Representative examples include teratoma, seminoma, embryonal carcinoma, and yolk sac tumor.

name: Adult teratoma
description: unknown disease

name: Granulosa cell tumor of the ovary
description: A granulosa-stromal cell tumor that arises from the ovary. It is characterized by the presence of granulosa cells that comprise at least ten percent of the cellular population. The granulosa cells are often found in a background that contains theca and fibrous cells. There are two major subtypes recognized, adult and juvenile granulosa cell tumor. Clinically, patients may present with an abdominal mass. Symptoms depend on the patient's age. The most important indicator of prognosis is tumor stage. Age over forty years at the time of the initial diagnosis, large tumor size, bilaterality, cellular atypia, and increased mitotic activity are factors indicating a potentially aggressive clinical course and relative poor prognosis.

name: central nervous system tumor, pediatric
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm of the brain, spinal cord, or meninges occurring in children. Representative examples include posterior fossa astrocytoma, optic pathway glioma, medulloblastoma, ependymoma, and craniopharyngioma.

name: Tinea cruris
description: Fungal infection of the groin. The main causative fungus is TRICHOPHYTON.

name: Systemic onset juvenile chronic arthritis
description: A category of juvenile idiopathic arthritis defined by the presence of arthritis and high fevers, and accompanied by at least 2 of the following systemic features: lymphadenopathy, organomegaly, rash, or serositis. Macrophage activation syndrome is a well known complication.

name: Dyspareunia
description: Recurrent genital pain occurring during, before, or after SEXUAL INTERCOURSE in either the male or the female.

name: Acute depression
description: unknown disease

name: mixed; epileptic
description: unknown disease

name: orthostatic; hypotension, neurogenic
description: unknown disease

name: Dialysis Catheter Infection
description: A local or systemic infection associated with the use of a dialysis catheter.

name: viral; infection, enterovirus
description: unknown disease

name: insufficiency; hepatic, postoperative
description: unknown disease

name: transplant; failure, kidney
description: unknown disease

name: Arthropod bite wound
description: unknown disease

name: Endocrine Breast Diseases
description: Breast diseases which are hormone-dependent or responsive to endocrine signals.

name: Anterior Cruciate Ligament Injuries
description: Sprain or tear injuries to the ANTERIOR CRUCIATE LIGAMENT of the knee.

name: Methamphetamine abuse
description: unknown disease

name: Radiation Sickness
description: unknown disease

name: Vitamin Deficiency
description: condition due to a deficiency of one or more essential vitamins.

name: Drug Dependence
description: Psychological craving for or habituation to the use of a chemical substance which may or may not be accompanied by physical dependency. Used for animal or human populations. Compare DRUG ADDICTION.

name: Cutaneous B-Cell Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
description: A B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma arising from the skin. Representative examples include cutaneous marginal zone B-cell lymphoma and cutaneous follicle center lymphoma.

name: Primary peritoneal carcinoma
description: A rare carcinoma that arises from the peritoneum and resembles the malignant surface epithelial-stromal tumors that arise from the ovary. Serous adenocarcinoma is the most common histologic variant. It affects women almost exclusively. The diagnosis of primary peritoneal carcinoma can be made only if both ovaries are not involved by tumor, or, if the ovaries are involved, the tumor is confined to the ovarian surface without invasion of the ovarian stroma and the peritoneal involvement is greater than the ovarian surface involvement.

name: Primary Peritoneal Serous Adenocarcinoma
description: A rare, serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the lining of the peritoneum. It affects females. The clinical behavior and pathologic characteristics are similar to the serous adenocarcinoma that arises from the ovary.

name: Leukemia, Large Granular Lymphocytic
description: A spectrum of disorders characterized by clonal expansions of the peripheral blood LYMPHOCYTE populations known as large granular lymphocytes which contain abundant cytoplasm and azurophilic granules. Subtypes develop from either CD3-negative NATURAL KILLER CELLS or CD3-positive T-CELLS. The clinical course of both subtypes can vary from spontaneous regression to progressive, malignant disease.

name: Sjogren's Syndrome
description: A chronic inflammation of the tear and salivary glands, often accompanied by rheumatoid arthritis and the presence of autoantibodies in the blood

name: Morphea
description: Isolated patches of hardened skin (scleroderma). [HPO:probinson]

name: Eosinophilic Pneumonia
description: An inflammatory lung disorder characterized by an increased number of eosinophils in the lungs. The majority of cases are idiopathic, without identifiable cause. In a minority of cases, medications, fungal infections, and environmental triggers have been implicated. It manifests as acute or chronic. Acute eosinophilic pneumonia is a severe and rapidly progressing pneumonia that may lead to respiratory failure requiring mechanical ventilation. Chronic eosinophilic pneumonia follows a slower course and manifests as fever, dyspnea, cough, and weight loss.

name: Disorder of rotator cuff
description: unknown disease

name: Methamphetamine dependence
description: unknown disease

name: Granulomatosis infantiseptica
description: unknown disease

name: Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia
description: pulmonary disease in humans occurring in immunodeficient or malnourished patients or infants, characterized by dyspnea, tachypnea, and hypoxemia; Pneumocystis pneumonia is a frequent opportunistic infection in AIDS; also found in other mammals where it is caused by related species of Pneumocystis.

name: Cancer anemia
description: unknown disease

name: ST segment elevation myocardial infarction
description: A clinical syndrome defined by MYOCARDIAL ISCHEMIA symptoms; persistent elevation in the ST segments of the ELECTROCARDIOGRAM; and release of BIOMARKERS of myocardial NECROSIS (e.g., elevated TROPONIN levels). ST segment elevation in the ECG is often used in determining the treatment protocol (see also NON-ST ELEVATION MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION).

name: Marginal zone lymphoma stage III
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage III: Involvement of lymph node regions on both sides of the diaphragm (III), which also may be accompanied by extralymphatic extension in association with adjacent lymph node involvement (IIIE) or by involvement of the spleen (IIIS) or both (IIIE,S).

name: Marginal zone lymphoma stage IV
description: Ann Arbor Classification: Stage IV: Diffuse or disseminated involvement of one or more extralymphatic organs, with or without associated lymph node involvement; or isolated extralymphatic organ involvement in the absence of adjacent regional lymph node involvement, but in conjunction with disease in distant site(s); or any involvement of the liver or bone marrow, lungs (other than by direct extension from another site), or cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Marginal zone lymphoma recurrent
description: The reemergence of marginal zone lymphoma after a period of remission.

name: adult giant cell glioblastoma
description: A giant cell glioblastoma occurring in adults.

name: adult gliosarcoma
description: A gliosarcoma occurring in adults.

name: adult acute myeloid leukemia with t(8;21)(q22;q22)
description: A gliosarcoma occurring in adults.

name: adult acute myeloid leukemia with t(16;16)(p13;q22)
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(16;16)(p13.1;q22) occurring in adults.

name: adult acute myeloid leukemia with inv(16)(p13;q22)
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with inv(16)(p13;q22) occurring in adults. Check for "https://www.cancer.gov/about-cancer/treatment/clinical-trials/intervention/C68697" active clinical trials using this agent. ("http://ncit.nci.nih.gov/ncitbrowser/ConceptReport.jsp?dictionary=NCI%20Thesaurus&code=C68697" NCI Thesaurus)

name: adult acute myeloid leukemia with 11q23 (MLL) abnormalities
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(9;11)(p21.3;q23.3); MLLT3-KMT2A occurring in adults.

name: adult acute myeloid leukemia with t(15;17)(q22;q12)
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(9;11)(p21.3;q23.3); MLLT3-KMT2A occurring in adults.

name: adult erythroleukemia (M6a)
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(9;11)(p21.3;q23.3); MLLT3-KMT2A occurring in adults.

name: adult pure erythroid leukemia (M6b)
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(9;11)(p21.3;q23.3); MLLT3-KMT2A occurring in adults.

name: adult grade III lymphomatoid granulomatosis
description: Grade III lymphomatoid granulomatosis that occurs in adulthood.

name: recurrent adult grade III lymphomatoid granulomatosis
description: The reemergence of grade III lymphomatoid granulomatosis in adulthood after a period of remission.

name: Fracture of lower leg
description: A traumatic break in one or more of the bones in the hip, thigh, leg, or foot.

name: Chronic Kidney Diseases
description: Impairment of the renal function secondary to chronic kidney damage persisting for three or more months.

name: Anemia in chronic kidney disease
description: unknown disease

name: Hormone receptor positive malignant neoplasm of breast
description: unknown disease

name: Muscle spasticity of spinal origin
description: unknown disease

name: Ocular histoplasmosis syndrome
description: unknown disease

name: Leprosy, Multibacillary
description: A form of LEPROSY classified by the World Health Organization for the purpose of treatment, based on clinical manifestations and skin smear results. Patients with multibacillary leprosy have six or more lesions with or without positive skin smear results for the causative agent MYCOBACTERIUM LEPRAE. Multibacillary leprosy encompasses borderline lepromatous, midborderline, and lepromatous leprosy.

name: Dapsone resistant mycobacterium leprae disease
description: unknown disease

name: Renal Insufficiency
description: Conditions in which the KIDNEYS perform below the normal level in the ability to remove wastes, concentrate URINE, and maintain ELECTROLYTE BALANCE; BLOOD PRESSURE; and CALCIUM metabolism. Renal insufficiency can be classified by the degree of kidney damage (as measured by the level of PROTEINURIA) and reduction in GLOMERULAR FILTRATION RATE.

name: Latent Tuberculosis
description: The asymptomatic presence of Mycobacterium tuberculosis in the body, which is determined by a positive result to a tuberculin skin test or interferon-gamma release assay.

name: Glioblastoma Multiforme
description: a type of brain tumor

name: Breastfeeding (mother)
description: unknown disease

name: Atypical Burkitt's lymphoma
description: unknown disease

name: Complicated appendicitis
description: unknown disease

name: Rhinocerebral phycomycosis
description: unknown disease

name: Arthritis, Bacterial
description: Joint inflammation that is caused by a bacterial infection within the joint space.

name: Prehypertension
description: Average of two or more properly measured readings at each of two or more visits after an initial screen with a systolic 120 to 139 mmHg or diastolic 80 to 89 mmHg.

name: BK virus nephropathy
description: unknown disease

name: HER-2 positive breast cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Pneumonia, Ventilator-Associated
description: Serious INFLAMMATION of the LUNG in patients who required the use of PULMONARY VENTILATOR. It is usually caused by bacterial CROSS INFECTION in hospitals.

name: Metastatic Malignant Neoplasm to the Leptomeninges
description: A serious problem that may occur in cancer in which cancer cells spread from the original (primary) tumor to the meninges (thin layers of tissue that cover and protect the brain and spinal cord). It can happen in many types of cancer, but is the most common in melanoma, breast, lung, and gastrointestinal cancer. The cancer may cause the meninges to be inflamed.

name: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
description: enlargement or overgrowth of the prostate gland as a result of an increase in the number of its constituent cells.

name: Disorder of electrolytes
description: A metabolic disorder that is characterized by electrolyte imbalances (e.g., hyperkalemia, hypokalemia, and hypercalcemia).

name: Chemotherapeutic Agent Toxicity
description: unknown disease

name: Other acute postoperative pain
description: unknown disease

name: Meningitis due to Klebsiella mobilis
description: unknown disease

name: Toxoplasmosis associated with AIDS
description: unknown disease

name: Chronic Bacterial Prostatitis
description: A chronic infection of the prostate gland caused by bacteria. It is manifested with recurring urinary tract infections. The culture of the prostatic fluid, semen, or post-massage urine specimen reveals the presence of bacteria.

name: Painful Bladder Syndrome
description: unknown disease

name: Prostatic Hypertrophy
description: unknown disease

name: Chronic iron overload
description: unknown disease

name: Aspiration pneumonitis
description: Inflammation of the lungs due to the inhalation of solid or liquid material.

name: Decompensated chronic heart failure
description: unknown disease

name: Chemotherapy-induced neutropenia
description: unknown disease

name: Dementia associated with Parkinson's Disease
description: unknown disease

name: hepatic complications
description: Any disorder of the liver occurring as a consequence of injury to the liver parenchyma.

name: EPILEPSY, PYRIDOXINE-DEPENDENT
description: unknown disease

name: Venous Thromboembolism
description: The migration of a blood clot formed within a vein to a site distant from the formation.

name: Irritable bowel syndrome characterized by constipation
description: unknown disease

name: adult nasal type extranodal NK/T-cell lymphoma
description: Nasal type extranodal NK/T-cell lymphoma that occurs in adulthood.

name: Diffuse Hyperplastic Perilobar Nephroblastomatosis
description: Small, focal or locally extensive basophilic cell mass of blast cells with ill-defined cytoplasm and nuclei, which may be present in one or both kidneys. May arise from remnant of developing metanephric blastema.

name: pancreatic polypeptide tumor
description: A benign or malignant neuroendocrine tumor that arises from the pancreas and secretes pancreatic polypeptide.

name: T-Cell Large Granular Lymphocyte Leukemia
description: A T-cell peripheral neoplasm characterized by a persistent (>6 months) increase in the number of peripheral blood large granular lymphocytes, without a clearly identified cause. (WHO, 2001)

name: Coronary Artery Disease
description: Pathological processes of CORONARY ARTERIES that may derive from a congenital abnormality, atherosclerotic, or non-atherosclerotic cause.

name: Calcium renal calculus
description: unknown disease

name: Severe persistent asthma
description: unknown disease

name: Philadelphia chromosome-positive acute lymphoblastic leukemia
description: unknown disease

name: HER2-positive carcinoma of breast
description: A biologic subset of breast carcinoma defined by high expression of HER2, GRB7, and TRAP100, and by lack of expression of estrogen receptor (ER).

name: Crohn's disease in remission
description: unknown disease

name: Transformed migraine
description: Episodes of migraine occurring on 15 or more days per month, for more than three months.

name: Right-sided Staphylococcus aureus endocarditis
description: unknown disease

name: Epidermal growth factor receptor positive non-small cell lung cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Precursor T-Cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia-Lymphoma
description: An aggressive (fast-growing) type of leukemia (blood cancer) in which too many T-cell lymphoblasts (immature white blood cells) are found in the bone marrow and blood.

name: Heart Decompensation
description: unknown disease

name: Gaucher Disease, Type 1
description: This type afflicts both children and adults who show no neurological effect. It is more prevalent in people of Ashkenazi Jewish ancestry.

name: Disorder of tendon of biceps
description: unknown disease

name: Chlamydia trachomatis infection of genital structure
description: unknown disease

name: Osteomyelitis due to Staphylococcus aureus
description: unknown disease

name: Anemia due to chemotherapy
description: unknown disease

name: Haemophilus influenzae type b infection
description: unknown disease

name: Bacteroides empyema
description: unknown disease

name: pharyngitis due to Haemophilus influenzae
description: unknown disease

name: Gout acute
description: unknown disease

name: candidal peritonitis
description: unknown disease

name: Lung transplant recipient
description: unknown disease

name: Influenza due to Influenza A virus subtype H1N1
description: An acute viral respiratory infection caused by a strain of influenza virus which is endemic in swine (pigs). Rarely reported in humans prior to 2009, the disease is caused by a mutated strain of swine influenza A (H1N1) virus. It is highly contagious and spreads mainly through coughing and sneezing. Signs and symptoms include fever, chills, coughing, sore throat headache, muscle ache, and generalized weakness. Antiviral medications are most effective in the first two days of the illness.

name: colorectal disorders
description: unknown disease

name: progressive keratoconus
description: unknown disease

name: transvaginal ultrasound: length of cervix
description: unknown disease

name: function of renal transplant
description: unknown disease

name: Non-Hodgkin's lymphoma of central nervous system
description: A non-Hodgkin lymphoma that arises from the central nervous system.

name: Acute postoperative pain
description: unknown disease

name: malignant neoplasm of large intestine stage IIIc
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T4a, N2a, M0); (T3-T4a, N2b, M0); (T4b, N1-N2, M0). T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. T4b: Tumor directly invades or is adherent to other organs or structures. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N2: Metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. N2b: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Liver carcinoma
description: primary malignant neoplasm of epithelial liver cells; it ranges from a well-differentiated tumor with epithelial cells indistinguishable from normal hepatocytes to a poorly differentiated neoplasm; the cells may be uniform or markedly pleomorphic, or form giant cells; associations exist with chronic hepatitis B virus infection, some types of cirrhosis, and hepatitis C virus infection.

name: Infection of bone
description: An acute or chronic infectious process affecting the bones.

name: Bulimia Nervosa
description: eating disorder that involves eating massive quantities of food (binge eating) and then eliminating the food by inappropriate compensatory methods to prevent weight gain, such as self induced vomiting or strong laxatives.

name: Chronic idiopathic neutropenia
description: unknown disease

name: Cryopyrin-Associated Periodic Syndromes
description: A group of rare autosomal dominant diseases, commonly characterized by atypical URTICARIA (hives) with systemic symptoms that develop into end-organ damage. The atypical hives do not involve T-cell or autoantibody. Cryopyrin-associated periodic syndrome includes three previously distinct disorders: Familial cold autoinflammatory syndrome; Muckle-Wells Syndrome; and CINCA Syndrome, that are now considered to represent a disease continuum, all caused by NLRP3 PROTEIN mutations.

name: Human epidermal growth factor 2 negative carcinoma of breast
description: unknown disease

name: Pseudobulbar affect
description: unknown disease

name: Microscopic Polyarteritis
description: Systemic vasculitis affecting small vessels that is necrotizing and non-granulomatous, with little to no immune complex deposition. Clinically it is characterized by involvement of the kidneys, skin, lung, and peripheral nerves. Antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody (anti-myeloperoxidase (anti-MPO)) is positive in most cases.

name: Adult Acute Myeloid Leukemia with t(8;21)(q22;q22); RUNX1-RUNX1T1
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with t(8;21)(q22; q22.1) occurring in adults.

name: Adult Erythroleukemia
description: An erythroleukemia occurring in adults.

name: Adult Pure Erythroid Leukemia
description: A pure erythroid leukemia occurring in adults.

name: Childhood myelodysplastic syndrome
description: An uncommon hematologic malignancy occurring during childhood. Many of the morphologic, immunophenotypic, and genetic changes seen in adult myelodysplastic syndromes are also observed in the childhood variants of the disease. Children present with neutropenia and thrombocytopenia more often than adults, and bone marrow hypocellularity is more often seen in children than adults.

name: Refractory Brain Neoplasm
description: Brain neoplasm that is resistant to treatment.

name: HER2/Neu Negative
description: The absence of detectable HER2/Neu in a tissue sample.

name: Relapse multiple myeloma
description: unknown disease

name: Pneumonia due to Staphylococcus aureus
description: unknown disease

name: Tinea barbae
description: unknown disease

name: HIV-1 infection
description: unknown disease

name: Chronic thromboembolic pulmonary hypertension
description: The persistence of thromboemboli in the form of organized tissue obstructing the pulmonary arteries, leading to an increase in pulmonary vascular resistance and progressive right heart failure.

name: acute leukemia in relapse
description: unknown disease

name: Hereditary factor XIII A subunit deficiency
description: unknown disease

name: Hemoglobin SS disease with vasoocclusive crisis
description: unknown disease

name: Nonsquamous nonsmall cell neoplasm of lung
description: unknown disease

name: Allergic rhinitis (disorder)
description: Inflammation of the nasal mucous membranes caused by an IgE-mediated response to external allergens. The inflammation may also involve the mucous membranes of the sinuses, eyes, middle ear, and pharynx. Symptoms include sneezing, nasal congestion, rhinorrhea, and itching. It may lead to fatigue, drowsiness, and malaise thus causing impairment of the quality of life.

name: Facial hyperpigmentation
description: unknown disease

name: Influenza due to Influenza A virus
description: unknown disease

name: Ischemic priapism
description: unknown disease

name: Epilepsy characterized by intractable complex partial seizures
description: unknown disease

name: Pulmonary Mycobacterium avium complex infection
description: unknown disease

name: Adult Acute Myeloid Leukemia with inv(16)(p13.1q22); CBFB-MYH11
description: An acute myeloid leukemia with inv(16)(p13.1q22) occurring in adults.

name: Stage IIIA Skin Melanoma
description: Stage IIIA includes: (T1-4a, N1a, M0); (T1-4a, N2a, M0). T1-4a: Non-ulcerated cutaneous melanoma of any thickness. N1a: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastasis in one regional lymph node. N2a: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes. M0: No detectable evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Stage IIIB Skin Melanoma
description: Stage IIIB includes: (T1-4b, N1a, M0); (T1-4b, N2a, M0); (T1-4a, N1b, M0); (T1-4a, N2b, M0); (T1-4a, N2c, M0). T1-4b: Ulcerated cutaneous melanoma of any thickness. T1-4a: Non-ulcerated cutaneous melanoma of any thickness. N1a: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastasis in one regional lymph node. N2a: Cutaneous melanoma with micrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes. N1b: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node. N2b: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes. N2c: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. M0: No detectable evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Stage IIIC Skin Melanoma
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T1-4b, N1b, M0); (T1-4b, N2b, M0); (T1-4b, N2c, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T1-4b: Ulcerated cutaneous melanoma of any thickness. N1b: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastasis in one regional lymph node. N2b: Cutaneous melanoma with macrometastases in 2-3 regional lymph nodes. N2c: Cutaneous melanoma with intralymphatic metastases (in transit or satellite metastases) without metastatic nodes. N3: Cutaneous melanoma with 4 or more metastatic nodes, or matted nodes, or in transit met(s)/satellite(s) with metastatic node(s). M0: No detectable evidence of distant metastases. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Hb-SS disease with vasoocclusive pain
description: unknown disease

name: Sepsis due to Staphylococcus aureus
description: unknown disease

name: Sepsis due to Pseudomonas
description: unknown disease

name: Post traumatic osteoarthritis
description: unknown disease

name: Congenital hemolytic uremic syndrome
description: unknown disease

name: Clinically isolated syndrome
description: A first neurologic episode caused by inflammation/demyelination of one or more central nervous system sites that lasts at least 24 hours.

name: Nephropathic cystinosis
description: An autosomal recessive condition caused by mutation(s) in the CTNS gene, encoding cystinosin. It is a sub-type of cystinosis, in which accumulation of cystine in the kidney results in renal dysfunction.

name: Nasopharyngeal carcinoma
description: A carcinoma that originates in the EPITHELIUM of the NASOPHARYNX and includes four subtypes: keratinizing squamous cell, non-keratinizing, basaloid squamous cell, and PAPILLARY ADENOCARCINOMA. It is most prevalent in Southeast Asian populations and is associated with EPSTEIN-BARR VIRUS INFECTIONS. Somatic mutations associated with this cancer have been identified in NPCR, BAP1, UBAP1, ERBB2, ERBB3, MLL2, PIK3CA, KRAS, NRAS, and ARID1A genes.

name: Generalized Myotonia of Thomsen
description: congenital genetic disease characterized by tonic spasm and rigidity of certain muscles when a voluntary movement is attempted; also known as Thomsen's disease.

name: Chronic ulcerative proctitis
description: unknown disease

name: Biotin deficiency disease
description: unknown disease

name: Cerebral Hemorrhage
description: bleeding or escape of blood into a cerebral hemisphere of the brain, including lobar, subcortical white matter, and basal ganglia hemorrhages.

name: Oestrogen receptor positive breast cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Hepatitis C recurrent
description: unknown disease

name: Fungal septicemia
description: unknown disease

name: Pulmonary arterial hypertension
description: Increased pressure within the pulmonary arterial circulation.

name: Stage IIIC Gastric Cancer
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T4b, N2, M0); (T4b, N3, M0); (T4a, N3, M0). T4a: Tumor invades serosa (visceral peritoneum). T4b: Tumor invades adjacent structures. N2: Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes. N3: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IB includes: (T1, N0, M0, G3); (T2, N0, M0, G1-2, GX). T1: Tumor invades lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. G1: Well differentiated. G2: Moderately differentiated. G3: Poorly differentiated. GX: Grade cannot be assessed-stage grouping as G1. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIA Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IIIA includes: (T1-2, N2, M0, Any G); (T3, N1, M0, Any G); (T4a, N0, M0, Any G). T1: Tumor invades lamina propria, muscularis mucosae, or submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. T4a: Resectable tumor invading pleura, pericardium, or diaphragm. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in 1-2 regional lymph nodes. N2: Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIB Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IIIB includes: T3, N2, M0, Any G. T3: Tumor invades adventitia. N2: Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIC Esophageal Adenocarcinoma
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T4a, N1-2, M0, Any G); (T4b, Any N, M0, Any G); (Any T, N3, M0, Any G). T4a: Resectable tumor invading pleura, pericardium, or diaphragm. T4b: Unresectable tumor invading other adjacent structures, such as aorta, vertebral body, trachea, etc. N1: Metastasis in 1-2 regional lymph nodes. N2: Metastasis in 3-6 regional lymph nodes. N3: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIA Colorectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIA includes: (T1-T2, N1/N1c, M0); (T1, N2a, M0). T1: Tumor invades submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N1c: Tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIB Colorectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIB includes: (T3-T4a, N1/N1c, M0); (T2-T3, N2a, M0); (T1-T2, N2b, M0). T1: Tumor invades submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N1c: Tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. N2b: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIC Colorectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T4a, N2a, M0); (T3-T4a, N2b, M0); (T4b, N1-N2, M0). T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. T4b: Tumor directly invades or is adherent to other organs or structures. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N2: Metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. N2b: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Colorectal Cancer
description: Stage IVA includes: Any T, Any N, M1a. M1a: Metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node). (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Colorectal Cancer
description: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1b. M1b: Metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IA Pancreatic Cancer
description: Stage IA includes: T1, N0, M0. T1: Tumor limited to the pancreas, 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Stage IB Pancreatic Cancer
description: Stage IB includes: T2, N0, M0. T2: Tumor limited to the pancreas, more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Stage IIA Pancreatic Cancer
description: Stage IIA includes: T3, N0, M0. T3: Tumor extends beyond the pancreas but without involvement of the celiac axis or the superior mesenteric artery. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Stage IIB Pancreatic Cancer
description: Stage IIB includes: (T1, N1, M0); (T2, N1, M0); (T3, N1, M0). T1: Tumor limited to the pancreas, 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. T2: Tumor limited to the pancreas, more than 2 cm in greatest dimension. T3: Tumor extends beyond the pancreas but without involvement of the celiac axis or the superior mesenteric artery. N1: Regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

name: Malignant epithelial neoplasm of female breast
description: unknown disease

name: Sepsis due to Gram negative bacteria
description: unknown disease

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of nose
description: unknown disease

name: Malignant epithelial neoplasm of thyroid
description: unknown disease

name: Factor II deficiency
description: unknown disease

name: Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis
description: Fatty replacement and damage to the hepatocytes not related to alcohol use. It may lead to cirrhosis and liver failure.

name: MYELODYSPLASTIC SYNDROME
description: A group of diseases in which the bone marrow does not make enough healthy blood cells.

name: Juvenile arthritis
description: Arthritis in children, with onset before 16 years of age. The terms juvenile rheumatoid arthritis (JRA) and juvenile idiopathic arthritis (JIA) refer to classification systems for chronic arthritis in children. Only one subtype of juvenile arthritis (polyarticular-onset, rheumatoid factor-positive) clinically resembles adult rheumatoid arthritis and is considered its childhood equivalent.

name: Advanced breast cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Locally advanced breast cancer
description: unknown disease

name: Growth Hormone Secretion Abnormality
description: An abnormal production of growth hormone.

name: Vitamin D-Resistant Rickets, X-Linked
description: unknown disease

name: Treatment-resistant schizophrenia
description: unknown disease

name: Perioperative hypertension
description: unknown disease

name: Streptococcal endocarditis
description: unknown disease

name: Pseudomonas aeruginosa meningitis
description: unknown disease

name: Ulcerative colitis in remission
description: unknown disease

name: Asymptomatic left ventricular systolic dysfunction
description: unknown disease

name: Lymphoma, Diffuse
description: malignant lymphoma in which neoplastic cells diffusely infiltrate the entire lymph node without any definite organized pattern; patients whose lymphomas present a diffuse pattern generally have a more unfavorable survival outlook than those presenting with a follicular or nodular pattern.

name: Hypoxic respiratory failure
description: unknown disease

name: Lipodystrophy due to Human immunodeficiency virus infection and antiretroviral therapy
description: unknown disease

name: Chemotherapy-induced peripheral neuropathy
description: Any disorder affecting the peripheral nerves resulting from exposure to chemotherapeutic agents.

name: Complex dyslipidemia
description: unknown disease

name: Inflammatory dermatosis
description: The presence of inflammation of the skin. That is, an abnormality of the skin resulting from the local accumulation of fluid, plasma proteins, and leukocytes. [HPO:probinson]

name: Stage IVA Colon Cancer
description: Stage IVA includes: Any T, Any N, M1a. M1a: Metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node). (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Thyroid Gland Follicular Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVC Lip and Oral Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVC includes: Any T, Any N, M1. M1: Distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: T4b, Any N, M0. T4b: Very advanced disease. Tumor invades prevertebral fascia or encases carotid artery or mediastinal vessels. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Thyroid Gland Follicular Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: T4b, Any N, M0. T4b: Very advanced disease. Tumor invades prevertebral fascia or encases carotid artery or mediastinal vessels. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1b. M1b: Metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: (T4b, Any N, M0); (Any T, N3, M0). T4b: Very advanced local disease. Tumor invades any of the following: orbital apex, dura, brain, middle cranial fossa, cranial nerves other than maxillary division of trigeminal nerve, nasopharynx, or clivus. N3: Metastasis in a lymph node, more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Lip and Oral Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVB includes: (Any T, N3, M0); (T4b, Any N, M0). T4b: Lip and oral cavity cancer with very advanced local disease. Tumor invades masticator space, pterygoid plates, or skull base and/or encases internal carotid artery. N3: Metastasis in a lymph node more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVB Colon Cancer
description: Stage IVB includes: Any T, Any N, M1b. M1b: Metastases in more than one organ/site or the peritoneum. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Thyroid Gland Papillary Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1a, M0); (T1, N1b, M0); (T2, N1b, M0); (T3, N1b, M0); (T4a, N1b, M0). T4a: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor of any size extending beyond the thyroid gland capsule to invade subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve. T1: Tumor size 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid gland. T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid gland. T3: Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension and limited to the thyroid gland, or tumor of any size with minimal extrathyroid extension (e.g., extension to sternothyroid muscle or perithyroid soft tissues). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1a: Metastasis to pretracheal, paratracheal or prelaryngeal/Delphian lymph nodes (Level VI lymph nodes). N1b: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral or contralateral cervical (Levels I, II, III, IV, or V) or retropharyngeal or superior mediastinal lymph nodes (Level VII). M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Thyroid Gland Follicular Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1a, M0); (T1, N1b, M0); (T2, N1b, M0); (T3, N1b, M0); (T4a, N1b, M0). T4a: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor of any size extending beyond the thyroid gland capsule to invade subcutaneous soft tissues, larynx, trachea, esophagus, or recurrent laryngeal nerve. T1: Tumor size 2 cm or less in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid gland. T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension, limited to the thyroid gland. T3: Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension and limited to the thyroid gland, or tumor of any size with minimal extrathyroid extension (e.g., extension to sternothyroid muscle or perithyroid soft tissues). N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1a: Metastasis to pretracheal, paratracheal or prelaryngeal/Delphian lymph nodes (Level VI lymph nodes). N1b: Metastasis to unilateral, bilateral or contralateral cervical (Levels I, II, III, IV, or V) or retropharyngeal or superior mediastinal lymph nodes (Level VII). M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IVA includes: Any T, Any N, M1a. M1a: Metastasis confined to one organ or site (e.g., liver, lung, ovary, nonregional node). (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Nasal Cavity and Paranasal Sinus Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N2, M0); (T4a, N2, M0); T4a: Maxillary sinus: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades anterior orbital contents, skin of cheek, pterygoid plates, infratemporal fossa, cribriform plate, sphenoid or frontal sinuses. Nasal cavity and ethmoid sinus: Moderately advanced local disease. Tumor invades any of the following: anterior orbital contents, skin of nose or cheek, minimal extension to anterior cranial fossa, pterygoid plates, sphenoid or frontal sinuses. T1: Maxillary sinus: Tumor limited to the maxillary sinus mucosa with no erosion or destruction of bone. Nasal cavity and ethmoid sinus: Tumor restricted to any one subsite, with or without bony invasion. T2: Maxillary sinus: Tumor causing bone erosion or destruction including extension into the hard palate and/or middle nasal meatus, except extension to posterior wall of maxillary sinus and pterygoid plates. Nasal cavity and ethmoid sinus: Tumor invading two subsites in a single region or extending to involve an adjacent region within the nasoethmoidal complex, with or without bony invasion. T3: Maxillary sinus: Tumor invading any of the following: bone of the posterior wall of maxillary sinus, subcutaneous tissues, floor or medial wall of orbit, pterygoid fossa, or ethmoid sinuses. Nasal cavity and ethmoid sinus: Tumor invading the medial wall or floor of the orbit, maxillary sinus, palate, or cribriform plate. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. N2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension, or in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IVA Lip and Oral Cavity Squamous Cell Carcinoma
description: Stage IVA includes: (T4a, N0, M0); (T4a, N1, M0); (T1, N2, M0); (T2, N2, M0); (T3, N2, M0); (T4a, N2, M0). T4a: Lip and oral cavity cancer with moderately advanced local disease. Lip: Tumor invades through cortical bone, inferior alveolar nerve, floor of mouth, or skin of face, i.e., chin or nose. Oral cavity: Tumor invades adjacent structures only (e.g., through cortical bone [mandible or maxilla] into deep [extrinsic] muscle of tongue [genioglossus, hyoglossus, palatoglossus, and styloglossus], maxillary sinus, skin of face). T1: Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension. T2: Tumor more than 2 cm but not more than 4 cm in greatest dimension. T3: Tumor more than 4 cm in greatest dimension. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. N1: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or less in greatest dimension. N2: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than 6 cm in greatest dimension; or in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension; or in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none more than 6 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIC Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIC includes: (T4a, N2a, M0); (T3-T4a, N2b, M0); (T4b, N1-N2, M0). T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. T4b: Tumor directly invades or is adherent to other organs or structures. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N2: Metastasis in four or more regional lymph nodes. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. N2b: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIB Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIB includes: (T3-T4a, N1/N1c, M0); (T2-T3, N2a, M0); (T1-T2, N2b, M0). T1: Tumor invades submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N1c: Tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. N2b: Metastasis in seven or more regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIIA Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIIA includes: (T1-T2, N1/N1c, M0); (T1, N2a, M0). T1: Tumor invades submucosa. T2: Tumor invades muscularis propria. N1: Metastasis in 1-3 regional lymph nodes. N1c: Tumor deposit(s) in the subserosa, mesentery, or nonperitonealized pericolic or perirectal tissues without regional lymph node metastasis. N2a: Metastasis in 4-6 regional lymph nodes. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIC Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIC includes: T4b, N0, M0. T4b: Tumor directly invades or is adherent to other organs or structures. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIB Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIB includes: T4a, N0, M0. T4a: Tumor penetrates to the surface of the visceral peritoneum. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Stage IIA Rectal Cancer
description: Stage IIA includes: T3, N0, M0. T3: Tumor invades through the muscularis propria into pericolorectal tissues. N0: No regional lymph node metastasis. M0: No distant metastasis. (AJCC 7th ed.)

name: Recurrent Primary Peritoneal Carcinoma
description: The reemergence of primary peritoneal carcinoma after a period of remission.

name: Osteolytic Lesions of Multiple Myeloma
description: A radiologic finding indicating the presence of multiple radiolucent osteolytic bone lesions observed in a patient with a diagnosis of multiple myeloma.

name: Oral Complication
description: Any oral disorder occurring as a consequence of injury to the mouth and lips.

name: Mucosal Melanoma
description: A melanoma that arises from a mucosal site.

name: Hormone-Resistant Prostate Cancer
description: Prostate carcinoma that does not respond to hormone therapy.

name: Adult Mixed Glioma
description: A mixed glioma that occurs during adulthood.

name: Asthma-chronic obstructive pulmonary disease overlap syndrome
description: Syndrome with clinical features of both ASTHMA and COPD.

name: cervical cancer
description: A tumor of the uterine cervix. []

name: Alopecia, Male Pattern
description: unknown disease
